Dumbbell-assisted squats: Hold a dumbbell in each hand and squat down, keeping your weight on your heels and your back straight. This will help you engage your legs and glutes, and add resistance to your squats.

Dumbbell shoulder press: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level, with your palms facing forward. Push the dumbbells up until your arms are fully extended, then lower them back down to the starting position. This will help you build shoulder strength and improve your posture.

Dumbbell lunges: Hold a dumbbell in each hand and take a large step forward with one leg, lowering your hips until both knees are bent at a 90-degree angle. Push back up to the starting position and repeat with the other leg. This will help you build leg strength and improve your balance.

Dumbbell rows: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body. Pull the dumbbells up to your sides, keeping your elbows close to your body and your back straight. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position. This will help you build back strength and improve your posture.

Dumbbell bicep curls: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing up, with your arms extended in front of you. Bend your elbows and curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, then lower them back down to the starting position. This will help you build bicep strength and improve your upper arm strength.
